item.title: UK retailer Co-op shuts down some IT systems after hack attempt
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: British supermarket chain Co-op Food has confirmed to BleepingComputer via a statement that it has suffered limited operational disruption as it responds to a cyberattack. [...]

item.title: Ascension discloses new data breach after third-party hacking incident
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Ascension, one of the largest private healthcare systems in the United States, is notifying patients that their personal and health information was stolen in a December 2024 data theft attack, which affected a former business partner. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Windows 11 24H2 updates fail with 0x80240069 errors
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has confirmed that Windows 11 24H2 feature updates via Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) are being blocked after installing the April 2025 security updates. [...]

item.title: Grinex exchange suspected rebrand of sanctioned Garantex crypto firm
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new cryptocurrency exchange named Grinex is believed to be a rebrand of Garantex, a Russian cryptocurrency exchange whose domains were seized by the U.S. authorities and an admin arrested. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Windows Server hotpatching to require subscription
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has announced it will require paid subscriptions for Windows Server 2025 hotpatching, a service that enables admins to install security updates without restarting. [...]

item.title: Hackers ramp up scans for leaked Git tokens and secrets
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Threat actors are intensifying internet-wide scanning for Git configuration files that can reveal sensitive secrets and authentication tokens used to compromise cloud services and source code repositories. [...]

item.title: France ties Russian APT28 hackers to 12 cyberattacks on French orgs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Today, the French foreign ministry blamed the APT28 hacking group linked to Russia's military intelligence service (GRU) for targeting or breaching a dozen French entities over the last four years. [...]

item.title: Apple 'AirBorne' flaws can lead to zero-click AirPlay RCE attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​A set of security vulnerabilities in Apple's AirPlay Protocol and AirPlay Software Development Kit (SDK) exposed unpatched third-party and Apple devices to various attacks, including remote code execution. [...]

item.title: SK Telecom cyberattack: Free SIM replacements for 25 million customers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: South Korean mobile provider SK Telecom has announced free SIM card replacements to its 25 million mobile customers following a recent USIM data breach, but only 6 million cards are available through May. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Outlook paste, blank calendar rendering issues
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has confirmed several issues affecting Microsoft 365 customers using the "paste special' option and the calendar feature in the classic Outlook email client. [...]

item.title: CISA tags Broadcom Fabric OS, CommVault flaws as exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) is warning of Broadcom Brocade Fabric OS, Commvault web servers, and Qualitia Active! Mail clients vulnerabilities that are actively exploited in attacks. [...]

item.title: Google: 97 zero-days exploited in 2024, over 50% in spyware attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Google's Threat Intelligence Group (GTIG) says attackers exploited 75 zero-day vulnerabilities in the wild last year, over 50% of which were linked to spyware attacks. [...]
